item.title: 疾病预防控制中心不向公众全面介绍不孕症治疗风险
item.description:
捐献卵子有健康风险。妇女无法了解哪家诊所的不良后果最少。【原文：

Egg donation comes with health risks. Women are unable to learn which clinics have the fewest adverse outcomes.

】

item.title: 父母与科技的关系比孩子更糟糕
item.description:
成年人牺牲社交联系，沉迷于手机，给孩子们树立了一个坏榜样。【原文：

Adults are sacrificing social connection to veg out with their phones, setting a bad example for kids.

】

item.title: 瑞典人工智能初创公司 Sana Labs 目标几年内在美国上市
item.description: 人工智能初创企业萨纳实验室公司（Sana Labs AB）的目标是在几年内成为美国的一家上市公司，加入瑞典科技公司青睐北美更深层次的资本市场这一日益增长的趋势。【原文：Artificial intelligence startup Sana Labs AB is aiming to become a public company in the US in a couple of years, joining a growing trend of Swedish technology firms favoring the deeper capital markets of North America.】

item.title: 美联储利率走势分化，美银策略师认为股市走势更佳
item.description: 美国银行（Bank of America Corp）的策略师表示，随着全球央行的降息速度超过美联储，股票涨势可能会变得更加广泛，从而帮助经济增长回升。【原文：Stock gains could become more broad-based as global central banks cut interest rates faster than the Federal Reserve, helping growth to pick up, according to Bank of America Corp. strategists.】

item.title: 关税风险缓解，欧元有望创一年来最佳一周表现
item.description: 在投资者降低了对降息的预期，并押注美国贸易关税不会像之前担心的那样很快生效之后，欧元将迎来一年多来表现最好的一周。【原文：The euro is heading for its best week in more than a year after investors pared back expectations for interest rate cuts and bet that US trade tariffs won’t come into force as soon as previously feared.】

item.title: 企业内部人士在 S&P 500 指数上涨中以创纪录的速度抛售股票
item.description: 本周，美国公司股价飙升至创纪录水平，似乎摆脱了对关税、移民和通胀的担忧。然而，公司高管们却在做一件明显不那么看涨的事：他们在快速抛售股票。【原文：Shares of US companies roared to a record this week, seemingly shrugging off worries about tariffs, immigration and inflation. Yet, company executives are doing something decidedly less bullish — they’re selling their stocks at a rapid pace.】

item.title: 中国三一重工考虑出售印度业务股权
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，中国工程机械制造商三一重工股份有限公司正在考虑出售其印度业务的股份。【原文：Chinese construction-machinery maker Sany Heavy Industry Co. is considering selling a stake in its India business, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 经济专员称欧盟面临落后于美国和中国的风险
item.description: 欧盟经济委员瓦尔蒂斯-东布罗夫斯基斯（Valdis Dombrovskis）表示，欧盟需要做更多工作才能跟上美国和中国的步伐。【原文：The European Union needs to do more to keep up with the US and China, according to Economics Commissioner Valdis Dombrovskis.】

item.title: 特朗普上任首周，国债毫无起色
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）就任第二任总统的第一周结束时，美国债券市场的表现与开始时差不多。【原文：The US bond market is ending the first week of Donald Trump’s second presidency pretty much where it began.】

item.title: 南非煤炭出口自 2017 年以来首次改善
item.description: 由于国有物流公司 Transnet SOC Ltd. 的铁路运输有所改善，南非七年来首次增加了非洲大陆最大码头的煤炭出口量。【原文：South Africa increased coal exports from the biggest terminal on the continent for the first time in seven years after an improvement in rail shipments by state-owned logistics company Transnet SOC Ltd.】

item.title: 英国采购经理人指数（PMI）显示，英国裁员速度为金融危机后所见
item.description: 2025 年伊始，滞胀的恐惧笼罩着英国，一项备受关注的调查显示，就业岗位的削减速度达到了金融危机后的水平。【原文：Stagflation fears stalked Britain at the start of 2025 with a closely watched survey showing jobs being slashed at a pace seen in the aftermath of the financial crisis.】

item.title: 贝恩支持的可持续燃料生产商 EcoCeres 将在欧洲上市
item.description: 贝恩资本（Bain Capital）支持的可持续燃料生产商 EcoCeres Inc.【原文：EcoCeres Inc., a producer of sustainable fuel backed by Bain Capital, is exploring an initial public offering that could value the company at about $5 billion, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 为什么股市可能处于集中风险的顶峰？
item.description:
凯文-穆尔（Kevin Muir）：为什么事情很快就会发生变化？【原文：

Kevin Muir on why things could change soon.

】

item.title: 股市集中风险可能达到顶峰
item.description: 现在有很多关于美国股票集中风险的讨论。例如，S&P 500 指数前十大股票目前占总指数的 38%，而十年前仅为 17.5%。而所有的大赢家都是苹果、英伟达、Meta 等科技公司，这不禁让人怀疑投资者是否对人工智能过于热衷。对一些人来说，这也勾起了他们对互联网泡沫的回忆。那么，美国股市目前的集中度到底有多高？集中度是多少？【原文：There’s a lot of talk right now about concentration risk in US equities. For instance, the top 10 stocks in the S&P 500 currently account for 38% of the total index, compared to just 17.5% a decade ago. And all the big winners have been tech companies like Apple, Nvidia, Meta, etc., prompting questions about whether investors are getting overly-enthused about AI. For some, it’s also bringing back memories of the dot-com bubble. So just how concentrated is the US stock market right now? What】

item.title: 欧元区私营部门意外恢复增长
item.description: 欧元区私营部门在连续两个月萎缩后，1 月份出现了增长，这令分析师感到意外，因为陷入困境的制造业出现了小幅改善的迹象。【原文：The euro area’s private sector grew in January after two months of contraction, surprising analysts as the embattled manufacturing sector showed small signs of improvement.】

item.title: 出售 33 亿美元债券后，菲律宾可能转向地方债务
item.description: 在实施了本年度的大部分海外筹资计划之后，菲律宾正在权衡在当地筹集 2025 年所需借款余额的方案。【原文：The Philippines is weighing an option to raise the balance of its 2025 borrowing requirements locally, having implemented the bulk of its overseas funding plan for the year.】

item.title: 法新社称斯里兰卡撤销与阿达尼集团的购电协议
item.description: 法新社援引未具名政府官员的话报道称，在去年美国调查指控斯里兰卡存在腐败问题后，斯里兰卡取消了与印度亿万富翁高塔姆-阿达尼（Gautam Adani）集团的购电协议。【原文：Sri Lanka has canceled a power purchase agreement with Indian billionaire Gautam Adani’s conglomerate after allegations of corruption in a US probe last year, AFP reported citing unnamed government officials.】

item.title: 照明制造商 Signify 宣布首席执行官 Eric Rondolat 将卸任
item.description: 飞利浦Hue智能照明制造商Signify NV表示，自2016年在证券交易所上市以来一直领导该公司的首席执行官埃里克-朗多拉特（Eric Rondolat）将卸任。【原文：Philips Hue smart lighting maker Signify NV said its Chief Executive Officer Eric Rondolat, who led the firm since its 2016 stock exchange listing, will step down.】

item.title: 印度马哈拉施特拉邦在达沃斯获得 2,000 亿美元投资承诺
item.description: 印度金融之都马哈拉施特拉邦首席部长周四表示，该邦在达沃斯签署了价值 2,000 亿美元的投资承诺，其中大部分来自外国投资者。【原文：The home state of India’s financial capital signed investment pledges worth $200 billion at Davos, with a majority coming from foreign investors, said Maharashtra’s chief minister on Thursday.】

item.title: 大选前德国商业活动趋于稳定
item.description: 德国私营部门的活动在经历了六个月的下滑后趋于稳定，这一出人意料的改善将在下个月的大选前受到政界人士的欢迎。【原文：German private-sector activity stabilized after six months in decline, an unexpected improvement that’ll be welcomed by politicians before a snap election next month.】

item.title: 日本计划出售紧急库存大米以降低价格
item.description: 为应对创纪录的国内大米价格，日本计划释放部分储备大米，以备不时之需。【原文：Japan plans to release some of its rice stockpiles reserved for emergency use in response to record domestic prices for the grain.】

item.title: EDP 希望将西班牙煤电厂厂址改建为数据中心
item.description: 由于人工智能推动了对新计算能力的需求，EDP SA 可能将其在西班牙的煤电厂退役后的土地用作数据中心。【原文：EDP SA may use the land of its coal plants in Spain that will be decommissioned for data centers as artificial intelligence drives demand for new computing capacity.】

item.title: 濒临破产的瑞士钢铁公司计划从本国证券交易所退市
item.description: 瑞士最大的钢铁生产商计划从瑞士证券交易所退市，因为该公司在激烈的竞争中挣扎，导致裁员，并呼吁政府提供援助。【原文：Switzerland’s largest steel producer plans to delist from the Swiss Stock Exchange as the company struggles with intense competition that’s led to job cuts and and calls for government aid.】

item.title: 中国开始降低价格目标以适应通货紧缩现实
item.description: 中国几乎所有地区都下调了今年的通胀目标，这很可能是 3 月份决定将全国通胀目标降至 3% 以下的前奏。【原文：Almost all Chinese regions have lowered their inflation targets for this year, in what’s likely a prelude to a decision in March to lower the national goal below 3% for the first time in over two decades.】

item.title: 因安全问题，特斯拉在中国为 120 万辆汽车部署修复程序
item.description: 特斯拉公司（Tesla Inc. ）将为其在中国销售的约 120 万辆汽车发布软件更新，以修复存在安全隐患的汽车动力转向和后视摄像头问题。【原文：Tesla Inc. will release a software update to about 1.2 million of its cars in China — about half the fleet it’s sold in the country — to fix issues with vehicles’ power steering and rear-view cameras that pose safety risks.】

item.title: 联合国承认的也门政府称特朗普此举可能会伤害胡塞武装
item.description: 也门联合国承认的政府副主席称，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普再次将也门胡塞武装组织归类为恐怖组织的决定标志着 "他们末日的开始"。【原文：US President Donald Trump’s decision to once again categorize the Houthi militant group in Yemen as a terrorist organization marks “the beginning of their end,”, according to the vice president of Yemen’s United Nations-recognized government.】

item.title: 经济衰退，法国呼吁 "大规模 "暂停监管
item.description: 法国官员呼吁从环境、社会和公司治理（ESG）规则入手，对欧洲监管框架进行重大改革，以解决该集团全球竞争力不振的问题。【原文：French officials are calling for a major reworking of the European regulatory framework, starting with ESG rules, to address the bloc’s flailing global competitiveness.】

item.title: 欧尔班将欧盟延长对俄制裁与乌克兰天然气输送联系起来
item.description: 匈牙利总理维克托-欧尔班（Viktor Orban）呼吁欧盟向乌克兰施压，以重建俄罗斯天然气向欧洲的输送，并将这一问题与扩大对莫斯科的制裁联系起来。【原文：Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban called on the European Union to pressure Ukraine to re-establish the transit of Russian gas to Europe, and linked the issue to extending sanctions against Moscow.】

item.title: 津巴布韦将保持紧缩货币政策以帮助 ZiG 创始人
item.description: 津巴布韦央行今年将保持紧缩的货币政策立场，以支持自推出以来九个月内贬值 48% 的货币。【原文：Zimbabwe’s central bank will keep a tight monetary policy stance this year to support its currency that’s lost 48% of its value in the nine months since it was introduced.】

item.title: 主要航线油轮运价下滑，制裁推动的反弹降温
item.description: 由美国制裁引发的从中东向中国运输原油的成本飙升已基本平息，交易商们又将目光转向了第一大进口国需求的疲软。【原文：A surge in the cost of ferrying crude from the Middle East to China that was triggered by a wave of US sanctions has largely unwound, with traders turning their focus back to weakening demand in the top importer.】
